rubrics.requirements: Distributed Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Platform

sub_tasks.requirements: Event Processing Engine
Core Event Processing Pipeline Architecture
Multi-Stage Data Flow Pipeline
Initial Event Ingestion and Filtering (Check/Allow Stage): Policy-based routing and conditional logic to accept, discard, or direct events through user-defined directed acyclic graphs

Data Parsing and Structuring (Parse Stage): Schema-driven parsing that deconstructs raw logs into canonical JSON with strict validation using type-specific parsers (IP, Date, Long, Text, Boolean, Binary, etc.)
Data Mapping and Transformation (Map Stage): Field modification, restructuring, and token processing with sandboxed helper functions
Data Enrichment and Normalization (Normalize/Enrichment Stage): Context augmentation with geolocation, threat intelligence, and KVDB lookups for security enrichment
Final Processing and Output Routing (Output Stage): Deterministic destination routing for archiving, alerting, and indexer delivery
Modular Backend Architecture
Server Module: Core processing engine that handles incoming data streams and connections
Orchestrator Module: Workflow coordination and overall data processing flow management
Backend and Persistent Storage Modules: Data storage, retrieval interfaces, and global state management
Specialized Data Modules: Geolocation enrichment (Geo) and Key-Value Database (KVDB) operations for in-memory lookups
API Module: Management interface and integration capabilities for external systems
Dynamic Asset Builder: Runtime asset compilation and deployment capabilities
Configurable Asset Management System
Asset Catalog and Namespace Organization
Versioned Asset Registry: Content-addressable storage for decoders, rules, filters, and outputs with version control
Multi-tenant Namespace Isolation: Isolated asset sets and runtime policies for different organizational units
Asset Type Classification and Processing
Decoders: Schema-aware parsing definitions for extracting fields from unstructured log messages with expression-based logic
Rules: Event evaluation logic with condition assessment, severity assignment, and alert triggering capabilities
Filters: Event flow control mechanisms based on specific criteria and conditions
Outputs: Pluggable output sinks defining serialization and delivery to files, indexers, or external search clusters
Helper Function Ecosystem
Condition Evaluation Helpers: Logic assessment and boolean operations for rule processing
Data Mapping and Transformation Helpers: Field manipulation, format conversion, and data restructuring functions
Parsing Rule Definitions: Expression-based parsing logic with prefixes, suffixes, and locale awareness
System Monitoring and Inventory Management
Inventory Harvester Module
Multi-Source Data Collection Architecture
File Integrity Monitoring (FIM): File system and Windows registry change detection with attribute and metadata tracking
System Inventory Collection: Comprehensive gathering of system information, packages, processes, ports, hardware, network interfaces, users, groups, and hotfixes
Delta Computation and State Reconciliation: Periodic snapshots with minimal update message generation against previous states
Data Processing and Integration
Wazuh Indexer Connectivity: Bulk indexing and searchable current-state indices maintenance
Configurable Data Filtering: Selective data forwarding and filtering based on collection policies
Automated Vulnerability Detection and Assessment
Stateless Vulnerability Scanner Module
Multi-Platform Vulnerability Detection
CVE Feed Management: RocksDB-backed vulnerability database with incremental updates from external sources (Ubuntu/Debian, CentOS/RHEL, Windows)
Real-time Vulnerability Correlation: Event-driven processing that correlates endpoint inventory data (OS, packages, hotfixes) against vulnerability databases
Syscollector Event Processing: Delta and synchronization event handling for OS, package, and hotfix correlation
Internal Data Management and Architecture
Local RocksDB Management: Vulnerability feed data and agent inventory state management for efficient scanning
Indexer Integration: Connection to Wazuh Indexer for agent data retrieval and vulnerability finding reporting
Data Serialization and Communication Infrastructure
FlatBuffers Schema System
Agent Communication Protocol
Agent Information Serialization: Compact, versioned message formats for agent metadata and status
SyncMsg Protocol: Full state and incremental delta transfer support for efficient communication
Data Structure Definitions
FIM Data Serialization: File and registry delta serialization with attribute and metadata encoding
Inventory Data Serialization: Provider union type system and synchronization message formatting for system inventory
Zero-Copy Serialization: High-performance, zero-copy data exchange between components ensuring interoperability
System Lifecycle and Operations Management
Installation and Deployment Framework
Multi-Platform Distribution: Package-based distribution system with system requirements validation and compatibility layer
Configuration Management: Schema-driven configuration validation with runtime implications handling and centralized configuration files
Maintenance and Operations Support
Data Persistence and Recovery: Backup and restore functionality for configuration and data with structured upgrade procedures
Performance and Security Optimization: Monitoring, tuning capabilities, security hardening, and access control mechanisms
Clean System Management: Structured uninstallation procedures and system cleanup capabilities
Development and Testing Infrastructure
Engine Development Toolkit
CLI Development Suite: Engine-suite CLI for compiling, testing, and validating assets offline with API communication testing tools
Specialized Testing Framework: Health checks, integration tests, and helper function testing utilities
Vulnerability Scanner Testing Framework
Database Management Tools: CVE database creation, injection, feed management, and RocksDB inspection utilities
Detection Testing Capabilities: Mocking capabilities and detection testing for vulnerability assessment validation
Debugging and Observability Framework
Live Debugging Capabilities: Trace-based debugging with severity and executable filtering for pipeline execution analysis
End-to-End Validation: Health and integration test harnesses for correctness validation across the entire system
